cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north tonight and accelerate north-northeast on Wednesday, making landfall on the northern Gulf Coast then racing inland across the Southeast toward the southern Appalachians, the Carolinas, and off the Mid-Atlantic coast by early Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast (within the Hurricane Warning area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL; Storm-Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River, LA to Navarre, FL including Mobile and Pensacola Bays
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle on Wednesday, then interior Southeast and the Carolinas on Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible Thursday; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds remains very low (≈3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the South Carolina coast from Zeta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Thursday, with localized minor flooding in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out Thursday as the remnants of Zeta pass inland.
